derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (as an adjective): from lag

entry.def: If you describe a country, company, or product as a laggard, you mean that it is not performing as well as its competitors.

example.ex: The company has developed a reputation as a technological laggard in the personal-computer arena.
example.tran: 该公司在个人电脑领域因技术落后遭人诟病。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who takes more time than necessary; someone who lags behind
1. inclined to waste time and lag behind

auth_sentence.content: Despite our proud railway heritage, Britain is a high-speed laggard.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despite our proud railway heritage, Britain is a high-speed laggard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despite our proud railway heritage, Britain is a high-speed laggard.

auth_sentence.content: While love made her brilliant,...it made me laggard and dull.
auth_sentence.res_content: While love made her brilliant,...it made me laggard and dull.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: While love made her brilliant,...it made me laggard and dull.

auth_sentence.content: Still, he says, Britain wasn't transformed from laggard to powerhouse.
auth_sentence.res_content: Still, he says, Britain wasn't transformed from laggard to powerhouse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Still, he says, Britain wasn't transformed from laggard to powerhouse.

stems_affixes.word_buile: lag拖延,落后+ard不好的人→laggard缓慢的,落后的人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 私生子;杂种;讨厌鬼;[俚]家伙;假冒品
stems_affixes.word_buile: bast愿意为结婚,后指不结婚而同居+ard不好的人→没结婚而生出来得的→私生子;杂种
cow威吓+ard不好的人→n.懦夫,胆怯者
drunk喝醉了的+ard不好的人→n.醉汉;酒鬼
lag拖延,落后+ard不好的人→laggard缓慢的,落后的人
nigg=niggle小气地做事+ard不好的人→n.吝啬鬼
slugg鼻涕虫[一种爬得很慢得虫];偷懒+ard不好的人→n.懒鬼

sentences.en: I would say the best students at Chengdu are no laggards.
sentences.cn: 依我看成都最优秀的学生绝不逊色。
